meanings.definition: In a qualmish manner; with uneasiness or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: She looked qualmishly at the roller coaster before deciding not to ride it.
meanings.sent2: He qualmishly approached the stage to give his speech, feeling nervous.
meanings.sent3: The cat eyed the vacuum cleaner qualmishly, unsure if it was a friend or foe.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathered qualmishly in the sky, hinting at an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the abandoned house made her feel qualmishly uneasy.

meanings.definition: Feeling or showing qualms; hesitant or uneasy.
meanings.sent1: She had a qualmishly expression on her face as she debated whether to speak up.
meanings.sent2: The student felt qualmishly about asking a question in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent3: His qualmishly behavior at the haunted house amused his friends.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a qualmishly charm, making visitors feel both intrigued and cautious.
meanings.sent5: The unfamiliar surroundings left her feeling qualmishly out of place.
